text: Explain how the heart is involved in control of blood pH during exercise * More carbon dioxide produced in respiration during exercise * This lowers the blood pH * Chemoreceptors detect increase in carbon dioxide concentration * Send nerve impulses along the sensory neurone to the medulla oblongata * Nerve impulses then pass along the sympathetic pathway * Noradrealine binds to the SAN * So more nerve impulses are passed here * Heart rate increases * Increased blood flow means carbon dioxide is removed faster so oxygen levels and pH levels return to normal \ \
